Pro Tip: Promoting the Cannon is the best one followed by promoting the melees then casters

actually promoting cannon minions is the worst pick if you want to use it for pushing because cannon minions get destroyed by the towers first promoting caster minions are the best choice if you want to push the lane as they get hit last by towers and will probably last 2 tower pushes if it can cause a large enough minion wave. 
if you want to use it to farm then its best in the order than you say
edit: i used to promote cannon minions for years and just a month ago i realized that if you promote casters that they get hit last so your promoted minion will do more damage to the tower over longer more likely kill the first tower and half kill if not kill the second tower it gets to too if left unchecked

Actually, you should promote cannons because they get so much tankier that it doesn't matter, yet they do a good deal back to the turret. They also kill minions REALLY fast and force the wave HEAVILY in your favor. The only time promoting a cannon is bad is if it takes too much minion aggro before it gets to a turret, cause if you got a ton of things blasting your cannon, then its still gonna die anyway while only killing 1 or 2 minions. Best way to avoid this is by upgrading them before they get into fights with the enemy wave.

Source? I build it when I support now. It's...just...so...fking...good.
they do get tankier but the tower focus them first still so they still wont be around as long as a caster minion so caster will do more damage cause its around longer to do damage

well actually, a melee minion is best is you're trying to fast push a tower in a cannon wave, you promote the cannon if you're doing it from base, if you're doing it in lane and pushing waves, casters, if pushing turrets, the last melee in the line.

I repeat:

1) Cannons for tanking turrets and pushing from base or needing to tank a turret

2) casters for shoving lane

3) Melee for shoving in turrets
Or as I heard: Cannon for sieging, mele for splitpushing, caster in a teamfight, as they are ranged and deal tons of damage.

sieging and split pushing are two different things.  if you wanna get a tower down fast and the wave is there when you use it, you upgrade the third melee in the row cause the tower goes in a numerical order to kill them (unless their is a cannon minion as it prioritizes that obviously).

Does it matter? They can kill 1 tower at most before the enemy team puts them down. The super caster *might* live longer, but he pushes the wave slower, kill the tower slower and as said, once the enemy team noticed the super, they'll take them down, if they haven't reach the tower by then, 100% useless. The cannon may die faster, but he WILL reach the tower faster and higher chance to do some real damages before getting caught.

the cannon has around the same damage as the caster and same tankyness as the meele only slightly more and because it pushes faster it wount survive a tower unless the tower  was already under half hp  because it will be the only cannon minion around and be the garenteed second target after the first meele minion that walks into tower range
Turrets ALWAYS prioritize promoted minions. So if one is going to die first, it will usually be the one you promoted, regardless.
